Author: brlewis
Content: Great, funny diagram.  I think a bidirectional arrow between C# and PHP is sorely needed, though.

Author: brlewis
Content: When he said the advanced stuff was too advanced I figured he was referring to SICP.  When he said the basic stuff was too basic I thought he might have been referring to HTDP.

Author: brlewis
Content:
It's job was to provide a gentle path away from C++. I'm not interested in a gentle path away from C++, I just want to write good applications.

I don't hate Java though. I can't complain because I do all my Java programming in Scheme.

Content:
What's this nonsense about Ruby being a "web language?"

That chart needs a thorough s/Ruby/Rails/g

Author: jcromartie
Content:
It's not that everybody hates Java; it's that nobody loves Java.

I'd guess that those who do say "I love Java" probably don't know any other languages. Maybe if the only choices were Visual Basic 5 and Java...?

Content: The Common Lisp Directory has a list of online resources (tutorials, references, books, blogs, etc.) here: http://www.cl-user.net/asp/tags/information

Author: dhimes
Content: I also bought a Vista-preinstalled laptop.  I haven't had any problems (except that Java lays out things a little differently), but I don't use it much.  I installed Fedora and use that machine as a dual boot.  I use Vista when I need wifi, cuz the drivers aren't available for fedora yet.

Author: dhimes
Content:
XP costs $200--half the price of the machine!

That's why I am willing to endure the pain of making Linux work. It's wonderful, but lags in driver release.
